Test Case Name: Verify Combined Aggregate Limit is not displayed for Binder on Coverage Page
Description: Ensure UI does not show Combined Aggregate Limit field when a Binder is selected
Step Description: 1. Login as a user with binder creation permissions; 2. Create a new Binder (or open an existing Binder); 3. Navigate to Coverage page for the Binder
Expected Result: The Combined Aggregate Limit of Liability field is NOT present anywhere on the Coverage page

Test Case Name: Verify absence persists after saving and reopening Binder
Description: Ensure saving a Binder does not cause Combined Aggregate Limit to appear later
Step Description: 1. Create and save a Binder; 2. Close the Binder; 3. Re-open the saved Binder and navigate to Coverage page
Expected Result: Combined Aggregate Limit is not present after save and on subsequent opens

Test Case Name: Verify backend/API does not return Combined Aggregate Limit for Binder
Description: Confirm API payloads for Binder coverage do not include the combined aggregate property
Step Description: 1. Create or identify a Binder; 2. Call the coverage details API (or relevant endpoint) for the Binder; 3. Inspect the JSON response
Expected Result: Response contains NO combinedAggregateLimit (or equivalent) property for Binder resources

Test Case Name: Verify exports/prints for Binder exclude Combined Aggregate Limit
Description: Ensure reports or exported documents for Binder do not show the field
Step Description: 1. Open a Binder; 2. Generate Coverage export (PDF/print/summary); 3. Inspect generated document
Expected Result: Exported documents for Binder DO NOT contain Combined Aggregate Limit text or values

Test Case Name: Verify switching from Policy to Binder hides Combined Aggregate Limit
Description: Confirm UI toggling between policy-type contexts removes the field for Binder context
Step Description: 1. Open an existing Policy that shows Combined Aggregate Limit; 2. Switch context (or change contract type) to Binder; 3. View Coverage page
Expected Result: When Binder context is active the Combined Aggregate Limit field is hidden; switching back to Policy restores field if applicable

Test Case Name: Verify user cannot add Combined Aggregate Limit while creating coverage under Binder
Description: Confirm 'Add Coverage' or similar flows do not offer Combined Aggregate Limit for Binder
Step Description: 1. Start 'Add Coverage' flow while creating/editing a Binder; 2. Browse available coverage fields/options
Expected Result: Combined Aggregate Limit is NOT available as an input option while Binder is selected

Test Case Name: Verify legacy Binder data with Combined Aggregate Limit does not display the field
Description: Validate system ignores legacy stored combinedAggregateLimit values for Binder UI
Step Description: 1. Seed system with legacy Binder record that contains combinedAggregateLimit value; 2. Open the Binder Coverage page
Expected Result: Even if legacy data contains a value, the Coverage page must NOT display Combined Aggregate Limit; value must be ignored in the UI

Test Case Name: Verify unauthorized role cannot enable/display Combined Aggregate Limit for Binder
Description: Ensure role-based controls prevent adding or showing the field
Step Description: 1. Login as a low-privilege user; 2. Open Binder Coverage page; 3. Attempt to enable or add Combined Aggregate Limit via UI or API
Expected Result: Low-privilege user CANNOT enable or add the Combined Aggregate Limit field; UI/API should reject attempts

Test Case Name: Verify toggling coverage options does not cause Combined Aggregate Limit to reappear
Description: Ensure dynamic UI changes do not accidentally surface the field
Step Description: 1. Open a Binder coverage page; 2. Toggle optional coverage switches/checkboxes and change coverage types; 3. Observe UI
Expected Result: Combined Aggregate Limit remains hidden under all toggles and option changes for Binder

Test Case Name: Verify API does not return Combined Aggregate Limit when queried with contractType=binder
Description: Prevent API regression where unsupported property is returned for Binder queries
Step Description: 1. Call coverage list/detail API with parameter contractType=binder; 2. Inspect response payloads
Expected Result: Response MUST NOT include combinedAggregateLimit property; if present, treat as regression/bug

Test Case Name: Verify importing policy data into a Binder does not surface Combined Aggregate Limit
Description: Ensure import process strips or ignores Combined Aggregate Limit when creating Binder records from policy imports
Step Description: 1. Import policy export (containing combinedAggregateLimit) into a new Binder via import tool; 2. Open the imported Binder Coverage page
Expected Result: Imported Binder must NOT display Combined Aggregate Limit; any imported combinedAggregateLimit values must be ignored or stored in non-displayed audit fields only

Test Case Name: Verify legacy/third-party print/export does not include Combined Aggregate Limit for Binder
Description: Ensure older export code paths do not reintroduce the field in Binder outputs
Step Description: 1. Use legacy export/print feature or third-party reporting that consumes Binder data; 2. Generate and inspect report
Expected Result: Report/print MUST NOT include Combined Aggregate Limit for Binder; presence indicates regression
